* Allegheny Beverage Corp., Cheverly, Md., announced the completion of the sale of its laundry services unit for $72.5 million. Allegheny refused to identify the buyer.

* Aluminum Co. of America, Pittsburgh, announced a price increase on a broad range of sheet and plate products by eliminating any current discounts. The company will also be charging for shipments at prices set at the time of shipment.

* Combustion Engineering Inc., Stamford, Conn., said a unit had received a $330 million contract to design and build a coal-fired cogeneraton plant and a carbon dioxide production facility for Applied Energy Services Inc.
* E.I. Du Pont De Nemours & Co., Wilmington, Del., announced a plan for a $60 million expansion of its Uentrop, West Germany, plant that makes its Sytel nylon resins.

* United Technologies Corp., East Hartford, Conn., said it had sold Elliott Turbomachinery Inc, its unit that makes turbine and compressor products for refinery applications, to a corporation whose shareholders include members of Elliott's senior management and other investors. Terms were not disclosed.
